text:

title: Close Open Position on Stopped Grid - EN
text:
To close an open position on a stopped Grid bot, please follow the steps in the provided screenshot:

**1 -)** Click on **"Futures"**.

**2 -)** Click on **"Bots"**.

**3 -)** Click on **"All Orders"**.

**4 -)** In the **"Running"** tab, locate the bot with the **"Stopped - position open"** status.

**5 -)** Click on the **"Position"** button.

**6 -)** You can choose **"Close Position"** to close a single position or click **"Close All"** to close all open positions related to that stopped grid.

**If you are stuck at any step, please take a screenshot and share it with us; we are here to support you!**
text_tr:
Durdurulmuş bir Grid botundaki açık pozisyonu kapatmak için lütfen paylaşılan ekran görüntüsündeki adımları takip edin:

**1 -)** **"Vadeli İşlemler"** (Futures) sekmesine tıklayın.

**2 -)** **"Botlar"** (Bots) seçeneğine tıklayın.

**3 -)** **"Tüm Emirler"** (All Orders) kısmına tıklayın.

**4 -)** **"Çalışıyor"** (Running) sekmesinde, **"Stopped - position open"** (Durduruldu - pozisyon açık) durumundaki botu bulun.

**5 -)** **"Position"** (Pozisyon) butonuna tıklayın.

**6 -)** Tek bir pozisyonu kapatmak için **"Close Position"** (Pozisyonu Kapat) seçeneğini kullanabilir veya durdurulan grid ile ilgili tüm açık pozisyonları kapatmak için **"Close All"** (Tümünü Kapat) butonuna tıklayabilirsiniz.

**Eğer herhangi bir adımda takılırsanız, lütfen bir ekran görüntüsü alıp bizimle paylaşın; size destek olmak için buradayız!**

title: Futures Swap Button (BNFCR) - EN
text:
You **can't directly transfer** BNFCR back to spot wallet, so you need to **swap it to BNB, BTC, or ETH** first to transfer it back to spot wallet.

### **Step-by-Step Process:**

1 -) **Click on** `Assets`
2 -) **Click on** `Futures`
3 -) **Click on** `USDsM Futures`
4 -) **Click on** `SWAP`

---

### **In the SWAP Page:**

- **Select** BNFCR 
- **Swap it** to one of the supported coins *(ETH, BNB, or BTC)*

---

> **Please make sure to select** `USDsM Futures` **from both options**

- ✅ **Choose the** *second sub-category option* **for your selected coin** (BNB, ETH, or BTC)

title: What Is Funding Rate? - EN
text:
The Funding Rate determines which traders pay or receive Funding.
On Binance Futures, **Funding Fees** are exchanged regularly to keep perpetual futures prices aligned with the spot price. Typically, funding occurs **every 8 hours** (at 00:00, 08:00, and 16:00 UTC), though Binance may adjust this to every 4, 2, or 1 hour during periods of high price divergence.

* **Positive Funding Rate (Contango):** This occurs when the **Futures Price > Spot Price**. In this scenario, traders holding **long positions** pay Funding Fees to those holding **short positions**.
* **Negative Funding Rate (Backwardation):** This occurs when the **Futures Price < Spot Price**. In this scenario, traders holding **short positions** pay Funding Fees to those holding **long positions**.

---

For further details, you can refer to these official articles:

* [What Are Funding Fees in Binance Futures?](https://www.binance.com/blog/futures/6595842576313788144)
* [Introduction to Binance Futures Funding Rates](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/360033525031)

If you have any questions regarding this topic, please share them with us as we are here to support you!

Fonlama genellikle **her 8 saatte bir** (TSİ 03.00, 11.00 ve 19.00) gerçekleşir; ancak yüksek fiyat farkı dönemlerinde Binance bu aralıkları 4, 2 veya 1 saate kadar düşürebilir.

* **Pozitif Fonlama Oranı (Kontango):** **Vadeli İşlem Fiyatı > Spot Fiyat** olduğunda gerçekleşir. Bu durumda, **uzun (long) pozisyon** tutan yatırımcılar, **kısa (short) pozisyon** tutan yatırımcılara Fonlama Ücreti öder.

title: ADL Indicator/Explanation - EN
text:
The indicator shown in the screenshot represents your position in the **Auto-Deleveraging (ADL)** queue. This is how the ADL works:

* **What is ADL?**: When the profit-loss difference between long and short positions cannot be covered by the **Insurance Fund**, the positions with the highest profit are closed automatically to manage market risk.
* **The Process**: This process is also known as **Counterparty Liquidation**. It is different from normal liquidation because you retain the current profit from your position and can re-enter the market immediately.
* **Indicator Lights**: Your proximity to ADL is shown by four bars; four red exclamations indicate you are at the top of the queue.
* **Rare Occurrence**: Even when all lights are lit, ADL happens extremely rarely. If all lights are lit, your position may be reduced in the event of a liquidation.
* **How to Avoid**: To reduce the risk of ADL, you can decrease your position size or close and reopen your position.

For more details, please refer to the official article:

* [Binance Auto-Deleveraging FAQ](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/360033525471)

If you have any further questions, please share them with us as we are here to support you!

Ekran görüntüsünde görülen gösterge, **ADL** (Auto De-Leverage) sırasındaki durumunuzu ifade eder. Bu sistemin işleyişi şu şekildedir:

* **ADL Nedir?**: Uzun ve kısa pozisyonlar arasındaki kâr-zarar farkı **Sigorta Fonu** tarafından karşılanamadığında, piyasa dengesini korumak için en yüksek kâra sahip pozisyonlar otomatik olarak kapatılır.
* **İşleyiş**: Bu işleme **Counter-party Liquidation** (Karşı Taraf Likidasyonu) adı da verilir. ADL, normal likidasyondan farklıdır; bu durumda pozisyonunuzdaki mevcut kârı alırsınız ve sonrasında tekrar işlem yapma şansınız olur.
* **Gösterge Işıkları**: **ADL** sırasındaki yeriniz 4 çubukla gösterilir; 4 kırmızı çubuk yandığında sırada en üstte olduğunuzu gösterir. 4 ışığın tamamı yanıyor olsa bile, **ADL** işlemi oldukça nadir gerçekleşen bir durumdur. Işıkların tamamı yandığında, bir likidasyon durumunda pozisyonunuz azaltılabilir.
* **Kaçınma Yöntemleri**: **ADL** riskinden kaçınmak için pozisyon hacminizi küçültebilir ya da pozisyonu kapatıp yeniden açabilirsiniz.

title: Stop-Market & Stop-Limit Differences - EN
text:
The difference between Stop-Market and Stop-Limit orders is based on the pros and cons of market and limit orders:

**Stop-Market Order:**

* It triggers a market order when the stop price is reached.
* Your order will execute immediately at the best available price.
* Exact price may differ from your stop price, especially in fast-moving markets.
* This helps protect you from big losses by closing the position quickly, though it might cause some slippage.

**Stop-Limit Order:**

* It triggers a limit order when the stop price is reached.
* Your order will only execute at the limit price you set or better, giving you control over the execution price.
* However, your order might not be filled if the market price moves away from your limit price.
* This provides price certainty but no certainty that your order will be executed, which can be risky in volatile markets.

**In short:**

* **Stop-Market =** No price certainty (better for a quick exit).
* **Stop-Limit =** Price certainty, no execution certainty (better when you want to control the trade price).

---

To learn more about order types, you can check this official guide:

* [Types of Order on Binance Futures](https://www.binance.com/en/support/faq/detail/360033779452)

text_tr:
Stop-Piyasa (Stop-Market) ve Stop-Limit emirleri arasındaki fark, piyasa ve limit emirlerinin avantaj ve dezavantajlarına dayanır:

**Stop-Piyasa Emri:**

* Durdurma fiyatına ulaşıldığında bir piyasa emrini tetikler.
* Emriniz mevcut en iyi fiyattan anında gerçekleşir.
* Özellikle hızlı hareket eden piyasalarda, gerçekleşen fiyat durdurma fiyatınızdan farklı olabilir.
* Bu emir tipi, pozisyonu hızlıca kapatarak sizi büyük kayıplardan korumaya yardımcı olur, fakat bir miktar fiyat kaymasına (slippage) neden olabilir.

**Stop-Limit Emri:**

* Durdurma fiyatına ulaşıldığında bir limit emrini tetikler.
* Emriniz yalnızca belirlediğiniz limit fiyatından veya daha iyisinden gerçekleşir; böylece gerçekleşme fiyatını kontrol edebilirsiniz.
* Ancak, piyasa fiyatı belirlediğiniz limit fiyatından uzaklaşırsa emriniz dolmayabilir.
* Bu emir tipi fiyat kesinliği sağlar, ancak işlemin gerçekleşeceğine dair bir kesinlik sunmaz; bu durum dalgalı piyasalarda riskli olabilir.

**Özetle:**

* **Stop-Market =** Fiyat kesinliği yok (hızlı çıkış için daha iyidir).
* **Stop-Limit =** Fiyat kesinliği var, işlemin gerçekleşme kesinliği yok (işlem fiyatını kontrol etmek istediğinizde daha iyidir).

1.  Click **[Trade]**

2.  Click **[Margin]**

3.  Click **[Cross]**

4.  Click **[Repay All]**

5.  Click **[Confirm]**

---

**What does 'Repay All' do?**

In summary, **Repay All** is a "De-Risking" button. It is designed to stop you from paying interest on loans without forcing you to sell your crypto assets.

When you click **[Confirm]**, the system performs three immediate actions:

* 🛑 **Stops Activity:** It cancels all your pending open orders so the math doesn't change while it's working.
* 🧮 **Calculates Debt:** It adds up every dollar you owe across all your different coins.
* 💸 **Pays the Bill:** It uses your available free balance (or sells just enough of your assets if necessary) to pay off that debt to zero.

**The Result:** You walk away with **Zero Debt** (so you stop paying interest), but you **keep your positions** (you still hold your Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc.).

> **Note:** This only works if your total debt is under **150,000 USDT**. If you owe more, you must repay some manually first.

To Learn more about the details, I suggest you to check the official guide:

[How to Use the Close Position and Repay Functions on Binance Margin?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/0ec778021b7a4f14b1b334f74b764b77)

title: How to REPAY ALL SYMBOLS on Isolated Margin - EN
text:
Here is the step-by-step pathway to access the "Repay All Symbols Debt" function and a clear summary of what happens when you use it.

Follow these steps to navigate to the function:

1.  Click **[Trade]**
2.  Click **[Margin]**
3.  Click **[Isolated]**
4.  Click **[Positions]**
5.  Click **[Repay All Symbols]**
6.  Click **[Confirm]**

---

**What does 'Repay All Symbols Debt' do?**

In summary, **Repay All Symbols Debt** is a comprehensive "Clean Slate" button for your **Isolated Margin** account. It is designed to clear all debts across all your different Isolated pairs at once using your available assets.

When you click **[Confirm]**, the system performs the following actions:

* 🛑 **Stops Activity:** It suspends new orders, transfers, and manual requests to prevent calculation errors.
* 💸 **Uses Available Funds:** It first uses any available assets you hold to repay your liabilities directly.
* ⚖️ **Closes Remaining Debt:** If your available funds aren't enough, it places market orders to sell assets and cover the remaining debt.
* 🛡️ **Buffer Added:** The system might place an order slightly higher (approx. +1%) than the exact debt amount to ensure there are enough funds to fully clear the balance.

**The Result:** You aim to walk away with **Zero Debt** across all your Isolated Margin trading pairs.

To Learn more about the details, I suggest you to check the official guide:

[How to Use the Close Position and Repay Functions on Binance Margin?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/0ec778021b7a4f14b1b334f74b764b77)

title: How to CLOSE POSITION on Isolated Margin - EN
text:
Here is the step-by-step pathway to access the "Close Position" menu on Isolated Margin and a clear summary of the two options available inside.

Follow these steps to navigate to the function:

1.  Click **[Trade]**.
2.  Click **[Margin]**.
3.  Click **[Isolated]**.
4.  Click **[Positions]**.
5.  Click **[Close Position]** next to the specific pair.

**Now, choose your desired action from the tabs:**

* **Option A (Full Exit):** Select the **[Close Position]** tab, choose which token to **[Settle in]**, and click **[Confirm]**.

* **Option B (Clear Debt Only):** Select the **[Repay Debt]** tab and click **[Confirm]**.

---

**A. What does 'Close Position' (Tab 1) do?**

In summary, the **Close Position** tab is your "Exit Strategy." It fully exits the Isolated Margin position for that specific pair.

* 🛑 **Settle & Convert:** You choose which cryptocurrency to settle in (e.g., USDC or DOGE). The system repays outstanding debt and converts the remaining assets into that chosen cryptocurrency.
* 📦 **Transfer to Spot:** Once completed, any remaining assets are automatically transferred to your Spot account.
* ⚖️ **Limit:** The position must be worth more than 0.01 USDT to use this function.

**B. What does 'Repay Debt' (Tab 2) do?**

In summary, the **Repay Debt** tab is a "Liability Clearer." It focuses only on paying back what you owe without necessarily closing your entire trade.

* 💸 **Uses Available Assets:** It uses your available assets to repay liabilities first.
* 📉 **Sells if Needed:** If you don't have enough cash, it places market orders to sell just enough of your position to cover the debt.
* 🛡️ **Buffer:** The system adds an approximate **1% buffer** to the order amount to ensure there are sufficient funds to fully repay the debt.

To Learn more about the details, I suggest you to check the official guide:

[How to Use the Close Position and Repay Functions on Binance Margin?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/0ec778021b7a4f14b1b334f74b764b77)
